study.name: NICHD_05_07_10_9.30PM
study.introduction: Thank you for agreeing to participate in this study.
study.egoIdPrompt: Please identify yourself to start or continue an interview.
study.alterPrompt:
Now I'd like for you to name 20 people that you know and who know you. These should be people you have had contact with sometime during the past year or so - either face-to-face, by phone, mail or e-mail. Please name adults age 18 and older only -- do not give me the names of children under age 18. Let's start by naming the people that are most important to you and then we'll work outwards toward people who are less important to you. You can name any adults you know no matter who they are or where they live. Please, first names only - we want to protect the privacy of those people. We do NOT want to know their last names.
INTERVIEWER: STOP AT 20 ALTERS
study.conclusion: Thank you for completing this interview.

question.title: STRUC1
question.preface: Going back to the list of people that you named earlier, I am going to ask you about pairs of these people and whether they have had contact with each other sometime during the past year or so - either face-to-face, by phone, mail, or e-mail. This part of the interview may get a little repetitive, so I appreciate your patience while we go through this section."
question.prompt: Have $$1 and $$2 had contact with each other sometime in the past year or so - either face-to-face, by phone, mail or e-mail?

question.title: ID
question.prompt: Enter participant ID

question.title: COMP1a
question.prompt:
Think about the last time you had sex with a woman. Is this woman one of the women you just named?
INTERVIEWER: IF ANSWER IS YES, SELECT WOMAN. IF ANSWER IS NO, NAVIGATE BACK TO THE PREVIOUS QUESTION AND ASK, "Can you tell me the first name of the woman you had sex with?" You can also give me initials, a nickname, or description of her.

question.title: Int_name
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER NAME:

question.title: COMP2
question.prompt: Please go down the list and tell me whether each person is male or female.

question.title: STRUC1a
question.prompt:
How frequently have $$1 and $$2 had contact with each other during the past year or so - either face-to-face, by phone, mail or e-mail? Would you say:
1 Rarely 2 Sometimes 3 Often

question.title: Site_Name
question.prompt: SITE NAME:

question.title: Int_ID
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER ID NO.

question.title: COMP4
question.prompt:
Who have you ever had sex with? By "sex," I mean sexual intercourse - vaginal or anal intercourse?
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ ALL THE NAMES. SHOW R THE LIST OF ALTERS AND HAVE R NAME THE SEX PARTNERS (IF POSSIBLE BASED ON LIGHTING, SEATING ARRANGEMENT, ETC.)

question.title: Int_date_month
question.prompt: INTERVIEW DATE: MONTH

question.title: DISP
question.prompt: DISPOSITION:

question.title: Int_date_day
question.prompt: INTERVIEW DATE: DAY

question.title: TIME_START_H
question.prompt: RECORD TIME STARTED, HOUR:

question.title: COMP4a
question.prompt:
Who have you had sex with in the past 6 months?
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ ALL THE NAMES. SHOW R THE LIST OF ALTERS AND HAVE R NAME THE SEX PARTNERS

question.title: TIME_START_m
question.prompt: RECORD TIME STARTED, MINUTE:

question.title: Int_date_year
question.prompt: INTERVIEW DATE: YEAR

question.title: COMP4c
question.prompt: Below is a list of the women you indicated having sex with on your list in the past 6 months. Can you confirm for me that this is correct?

question.title: TIME_START_AP
question.prompt: RECORD TIME STARTED, AM/PM:

question.title: Site_No
question.prompt: Site ID NO.

question.title: COMP4d
question.prompt:
You mentioned earlier that you've had <VAR SEX2b/> female sex partners during the past 6 months, and you listed <COUNT COMP4c "Yes"/> of these female sex partners so far. Can you provide the first names or nicknames of <CALC SEX2b - <COUNT COMP4c "Yes"/>/> additional sex partners? As reminder, by "sex" I mean either vaginal or anal intercourse, not oral sex.
INTERVIEWER: NAVIGATE BACK TO COMP1 AND ADD ADDITIONAL NAMES. CHECK THE ADDITIONAL SEXUAL PARTNERS HERE.

question.title: ONE_MONTH_AGO
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN THE MONTH AND YEAR OF ONE MONTH AGO.

question.title: COMP4e
question.prompt: <IF COMP4c <= 4 "INTERVIEWER, PLEASE CHECK ALL OF THE BOXES BELOW AND MOVE TO THE NEXT QUESTION"/> <IF COMP4c > 4 "Out of these <COUNT COMP4c/> female sex partners, please tell me the last four."/>

question.title: COMP5
question.prompt:
Who did you drink alcohol with during the past 6 months?
INTERVIEWER: REFERS TO BOTH R AND ALTER DRINKING.

question.title: SIX_MONTHS_AGO
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN THE MONTH AND YEAR OF SIX MONTHS AGO.

question.title: COMP6
question.prompt:
Who did you use drugs with during the past 6 months?
INTERVIEWER: REFERS TO BOTH R AND ALTER USING DRUGS

question.title: ONE_YEAR_AGO
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER: TYPE IN THE MONTH AND YEAR OF ONE YEAR AGO.

question.title: COMP3
question.prompt: Who is a relative or relative through marriage like a parent, brother or sister, cousin, aunt, uncle, or in-law? If you have been married, do not include your wife or ex-wife.

question.title: DEMO1_mo
question.preface:
First, I want to ask you some background questions.
I know I just asked your age, but I have to record your date of birth here, too.
question.prompt: In what month were you born?

question.title: COMP7
question.prompt: Which of the women you named is a wife or ex-wife, if any?

question.title: DEMO1_yr
question.prompt: In what year were you born?

question.title: DEMO2
question.prompt: Are you Hispanic or Latino?

question.title: COMP8
question.preface: Now I'm going to ask you a few questions about your relationships with these people.
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months (since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>), how often have you had contact with $$? By contact, I mean in person or by phone, mail, or email. (CARD X)
INTERVIEWER: IF R HAS DIFFICULTY DUE TO INCONSISTENT CONTACT OVER PAST 6 MO. SAY, "Then think about how often, on average, you have had contact with [NAME] during the past 6 months."

question.title: DEMO3
question.preface: Now I need to ask you a question about your racial group.
question.prompt: What would you say is your main racial group? Please let me know when I have read the right one. 1 Black or African American 2 White (European American or "Anglo") 3 Native American/Alaskan Native 4 Asian or Pacific Islander 5 Some other race (SPECIFY: _________________) 6 Multiracial or mixed race

question.title: COMP9
question.prompt: Who have you felt emotionally close to most of the time during the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>?

question.title: DEMO3a
question.prompt:
You indicated multiracial. Please select all races that apply.
(INTERVIEWER: CODE ALL THAT APPLY)
1 Black or African American 2 White (European American or "Anglo") 3 Native American/Alaskan Native 4 Asian or Pacific Islander 5 Some other race (SPECIFY: _________________)

question.title: COMP10
question.prompt: Who has provided you with food, money, clothes, or a place to stay because you needed it during the past 6 months?

question.title: DEMO4
question.prompt: What is the highest grade in school or year of college that you completed and got credit for?

question.title: COMP11
question.prompt: Who has given you advice or information to help you solve a problem during the past 6 months?

question.title: COMP12
question.prompt: Who would you say is a friend of yours?

question.title: DEMO5
question.prompt: Have you had any children, including by birth or adoption?

question.title: DEMO6
question.prompt:
What's your current marital status? (INTERVIEWER: ASK ALL, CHOOSE ONE)
1 Never Married 2 Married 3 Divorced 4 Separated 5 Widowed

question.title: COMP13
question.prompt:
Who do you think has been homeless during the past 6 months (since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>)?
INTERVIEWER: LET R DEFINE "HOMELESS"

question.title: COMP14
question.preface: Now I want to ask you whether these people did certain things during the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>. If you don't know for sure, that's OK - we just want to know your best guess.
question.prompt: Who do you think has drunk alcohol to the point of being high, drunk, or buzzed during the past 6 months?

question.title: DEMO7
question.prompt:
Which of the following best describes your employment situation most of the time during the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>?
1 Full-time paid job (> 35 hours/week) 2 Part-time paid job 3 Unemployed, but not looking for work 4 Unemployed and looking for work 5 Student/vocational training 6 Something else? (SPECIFY: _____________)

option.name: Unemployed, but not looking for work

question.title: COMP15
question.prompt: Who do you think has used drugs like the ones we talked about earlier (for example, pot, crack, or something else) during the past 6 months? Again, if you don't know for sure, just give me your best guess.

question.title: DEMO8
question.prompt:
What was your total income during the past 30 days, since <VAR ONE_MONTH_AGO/>? Please consider any money from all sources including any jobs, tips, welfare or general relief, other government help, or any activities either legal or under the table?
(INTERVIEWER: ROUND TO THE NEAREST DOLLAR)

question.title: COMP16
question.prompt: Who do you think has done any of the following things during the past 6 months: had multiple sex partners, had sex with someone they didn't know, or didn't use a condom with a new partner? Again, if you don't know for sure, just give me your best guess.

question.title: RELIG1
question.prompt: Currently, how important is religion or spirituality in your daily life? Would you say it is (CHOOSE ONE): 1 Not at all 2 A little bit 3 Somewhat 4 Quite a bit

question.title: MILI1
question.preface: I would like to ask you a few questions now about military service.
question.prompt: Have you ever served in the military or National Guard?

question.title: COMP17
question.prompt: Who have you talked with about the risk of getting HIV or AIDS during the past 6 months? INTERVIEWER: EVEN IF THEY JUST TALKED ABOUT USING CONDOMS, IT COUNTS "YES"

question.title: MILI2
question.prompt:
Are you currently: (CHOOSE ONE)
1 In the National Guard or Reserve 2 Active duty military 3 A veteran

option.name: In the National Guard or Reserve

question.title: COMP17a
question.prompt: Did you either give or receive advice or information about HIV/AIDS?

question.title: COMP17b
question.prompt: Did you talk about using condoms to prevent HIV/AIDS?

question.title: MILI2a
question.prompt: What is your discharge status?

question.title: MILI3
question.prompt: Have you ever served overseas in a combat zone?

question.title: COMP18
question.prompt: Who do you think has spent at least one night in jail or prison during the past 6 months?

question.title: MILI4a
question.prompt:
In which country did you serve in a combat zone? (INTERVIEWER: ASK ALL, CHECK ALL THAT APPLY)
1 Iraq 2 Afghanistan 3 Vietnam 4 Any others countries? (SPECIFY: ________)

question.title: COMP19
question.prompt:
Who currently has regular or steady employment?
INTERVIEWER: WE'RE ONLY INTERESTED IN LEGAL EMPLOYMENT - DO NOT COUNT PROSTITUTION, DRUG DEALING, OR OTHER ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES, EVEN IF REGULAR OR STEADY "EMPLOYMENT"

question.title: COMP19a
question.prompt:
Are any of the people you named transsexuals? That is, they are either biological males living as women, or biological females living as men?
INTERVIEWER: If necessary, define biological males as "has a penis" and biological females as "has a vagina." If necessary, define "living as woman" as "appears to be a woman or is treated by most people as a woman" and "living as a man" as "appears to be a man or is treated by most people as a man."

question.title: MILI4b_m
question.prompt: When did your last overseas deployment END -- what month? (INTERVIEWER: ENTER MONTH)

question.title: COMP20
question.preface: Next, let's talk about how you met each of these people.
question.prompt:
How did you first meet $$?
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ RESPONSE OPTIONS TO R. CODE R'S RESPONSE INTO ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:

option.name: MET IN A SHELTER OR OTHER SERVICE SITE (INCLUDING SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT)
MET THROUGH A JOB OR SCHOOL
MET THROUGH RELIGIOUS OR NON-RELIGIOUS ORGANIZATION (NOT AA OR NA)
MET THROUGH AA, NA, OR OTHER SELF-HELP GROUP
MET IN A BAR OR CLUB
MET THROUGH DRUG OR ALCOHOL USE (THEIRS OR ALTER'S)
MET ON THE STREET (INCLUDE MEAL LINES, ENCAMPMENTS)
MET THROUGH THE INTERNET/SOCIAL NETWORKING SITES
MET THROUGH THE MILITARY OR VA/VET CENTER

question.title: MILI4b_y
question.prompt: When did your last overseas deployment END -- what year? (INTERVIEWER: ENTER YEAR)

question.title: RESID1
question.preface: Now I want to ask you some questions about the different types of places where you may have lived during your lifetime.
question.prompt: Do you currently have a regular place to stay, like your own house, apartment, or room, or the home of a family member or friend? If you are currently staying in a homeless shelter or transitional program, do not count that as a regular place to stay. (INTERVIEWER: SRO IS CONSIDERED A REGULAR PLACE TO STAY, NOT HOMELESS)

question.title: COMP20a
question.prompt: WAS THAT A:

question.title: RESID1a1
question.prompt:
What would you say is the most important reason why you don't have a regular place to stay right now?
(INTERVIEWER: WRITE VERBATIM ANSWER AND THEN CHECK ALL THAT APPLY ON SUBSEQUENT SCREEN. DO NOT PROBE FOR MULTIPLE REASONS; HOWEVER, IF RESPONDENT GIVES MORE THAN ONE REASON, CHECK ALL THAT APPLY AND USE "OTHER" FILL-IN IF NECESSARY.)

question.title: COMP20a2
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

option.name: SERVICE PROVIDER (A MENTAL HEALTH OR DRUG TREATMENT COUNSELOR; DOCTOR, NURSE, OR COUNSELOR; CASEWORKER; SOCIAL WORKER)
LOWER LEVEL STAFF (E.G. RECEPTIONIST, JANITOR, COOK, SECURITY)

question.title: COMP20b
question.prompt: WAS THAT:

question.title: RESID1a2
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER: CHECK ALL THAT APPLY. DO NOT PROBE FOR MULTIPLE REASONS; HOWEVER, IF RESPONDENT GIVES MORE THAN ONE REASON, CHECK ALL THAT APPLY AND USE "OTHER" FILL-IN IF NECESSARY.

option.name: TOO MANY PEOPLE/TOO CROWDED WHRE I WAS STAYING
RELEASED FROM JAIL, PRISON, JUVENILE FACILITY
WANTED TO BE ON MY OWN; FREEDOM

question.title: RESID2
question.prompt: During your lifetime, have you ever spent the night in any of the following places because you had no regular place to stay like your own house, apartment, or room, or the home of a family member or friend?

option.name: A homeless emergency shelter or transitional shelter
an indoor public place like an all-night theater or church (but not in a bed)
the street or in some other outdoor place
garage or shed that was not meant for living in

question.title: COMP20b2
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

question.title: RESID3d
question.prompt:
If you added up all the time you stayed in <VAR RESID2/> because you didn't have a regular place to stay, about how much time altogether would that be in your lifetime?
(INTERVIEWER: ENTER DAYS/NIGHTS IN LIFETIME)

question.title: COMP20c
question.prompt: WAS THAT:

option.name: THROUGH CHURCH OR OTHER RELIGIOUS ORGANIZATION

question.title: RESID3w
question.prompt: WEEKS IN LIFETIME

question.title: COMP20c2
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

option.name: ORGANIZATION LEADER (E.G. PRIEST, MINISTER, GROUP LEADER)
LOWER LEVEL STAFF (E.G. RECEPTIONIST, JANITOR, SECURITY)

question.title: RESID3m
question.prompt: MONTHS IN LIFETIME

question.title: COMP20d
question.prompt: WAS THAT:

question.title: COMP20d2
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

option.name: LOWER LEVEL STAFF (E.G. RECEPTIONIST, JANITOR, SECURITY)

question.title: RESID3y
question.prompt: YEARS IN LIFETIME

question.title: RESID3check
question.prompt: RESID3d, RESID3w, RESID3m, and RESID3y CAN'T ALL BE = 0. PLEASE NAVIGATE BACK AND REVISE.

question.title: COMP20e
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

question.title: RESID4d
question.prompt:
How about during the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>: how much time have you stayed in (<VAR RESID2/>)?
(INTERVIEWER: ENTER DAYS/NIGHTS IN LAST SIX MONTHS)

question.title: COMP20f
question.prompt: WAS THAT:

question.title: COMP20g
question.prompt: WAS THAT:

question.title: RESID4w
question.prompt: (INTERVIEWER: ENTER WEEKS IN LAST SIX MONTHS)

question.title: COMP20h
question.prompt: WAS $$ A:

option.name: SERVICE PROVIDER LIKE A DOCTOR, NURSE, OR COUNSELOR

question.title: RESID4m
question.prompt: (INTERVIEWER: ENTER MONTHS IN LAST SIX MONTHS)

question.title: RESID5
question.prompt: Thinking about <VAR Site_Name/>, did you sleep here last night?

question.title: COMP20i
question.prompt: $$ WAS: (VERBATIM)

question.title: RESID6
question.prompt: Do you plan to sleep at <VAR Site_Name/> tonight?

question.title: SEXALT1
question.preface: Now I am going to ask you some questions about your recent sex partners.
question.prompt: Do you consider $$ to be a current sexual partner?

question.title: SEXALT2d
question.prompt:
How long have you known $$? How many days?
INTERVIEWER: IF R INDICATES THAT RELATIONSHIP IS OVER, YOU CAN CHANGE WORDING TO: "For how long did you know [NAME]?"

question.title: SERV1
question.prompt:
During the past 30 days, how many nights have you stayed in an emergency shelter or transitional housing in the Skid Row area? Do not include SRO facilities in your answer.
INTERVIEWER: IF NEEDED, DEFINE "SKID ROW AREA" AS AREA OF DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES BOUNDED BY 3rd ST (ON THE NORTH), CENTRAL AVE. (ON THE EAST), 8TH ST. (ON THE SOUTH), AND LOS ANGELES ST. (ON THE WEST).

question.title: SEXALT2w
question.prompt: How many weeks?

question.title: SERV2b
question.prompt:
During the past 30 days, how many times have you eaten breakfast, lunch, or dinner at a meal line in the Skid Row area?
(ENTER NUMBER OF TIMES ATE BREAKFAST)

question.title: SERV2l
question.prompt: (INTERVIEWER: ENTER NUMBER OF TIMES ATE LUNCH)

question.title: SEXALT2m
question.prompt: How many months?

question.title: SERV2d
question.prompt: (INTERVIEWER: ENTER NUMBER OF TIMES ATE DINNER)

question.title: SEXALT2y
question.prompt: How many years?

question.title: SERV3
question.prompt: During the past 30 days, have you used the following services or assistance in the Skid Row area?

option.name: Drop-in or access center (where you can get some of the things that you need like clean clothes or a shower or different services)

question.title: SEXALT2check
question.prompt: RESPONSES TO SEXALT2d, SEXALT2w, SEXALT2M and SEXALT2y CAN'T ALL BE = 0. PLEASE NAVIGATE BACK AND REVISE.

question.title: SEXALT3a
question.prompt: Men have different kinds of sexual partners. The last time you had sex with $$, was she a serious or primary partner? This means a serious relationship with a wife, girlfriend, or other "steady partner."

question.title: LEGAL1
question.preface: Now I am going to ask you some questions about jail or prison. As you know, this survey is anonymous - I'm not recording your name anywhere and so I cannot connect your name to the responses that you provide. So I hope you will be honest with me.
question.prompt: During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, what is the total number of nights, if any, that you have spent in jail?

question.title: LEGAL2
question.prompt: During the past 6 months, since since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, what is the total number of nights, if any, that you have spent in prison?

question.title: SEXALT3b
question.prompt:
Was she your wife, fiance, or girlfriend, or other type of serious partner?
[INTERVIEWER: OFFER OPTIONS 4 AND 5 ONLY IF R DOES NOT CHOOSE WIFE, FIANCE, OR GIRLFRIEND]

question.title: SEXALT3c
question.prompt:
Was she a stranger, acquaintance, or friend, or other type of casual partner?
[INTERVIEWER: OFFER OPTIONS 3 AND 4 ONLY IF R DOES NOT CHOOSE STRANGER, ACQUAINTANCE, OR FRIEND]

question.title: LEGAL3
question.prompt: During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, were you at any time on probation, parole, supervised release, or any other conditional release from jail or prison?

question.title: SEXALT3d
question.prompt: In the past 6 months, have YOU given $$ money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex with her?

question.title: HEALTH1
question.preface: Next, I have a few questions about your general health and well-being.
question.prompt:
In general, would you say your health is:
(INTERVIEWER: READ ALL, SELECT ONE)
1 Excellent 2 Very good 3 Good 4 Fair 5 Poor

question.title: MH1a
question.prompt:
Now I want to ask you how you have been feeling lately. For each of the following questions, please tell me the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling during the past month, since <VAR ONE_MONTH_AGO/>. You can answer "none of the time," "a little of the time," "some of the time," "a good bit of the time," most of the time," or "all of the time." (CARD X)
(INTERVIEWER: EMPHASIZE SHIFT IN RESPONSE OPTIONS AND TIME FRAME TO PAST MONTH.)
During the past month, how much of the time:
Have you felt calm and peaceful?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT3e
question.prompt: In the past 6 months, has $$ GIVEN YOU money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex with her?

question.title: MH1b
question.prompt: Have you felt downhearted and blue?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT5
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, about how many times have you had vaginal or anal sex with $$?
INTERVIEWER: IF NEEDED, CLARIFY: "By number of times, we mean each episode of sex, not number of nights."

question.title: SEXALT6
question.prompt: How many of these times did you use a condom with $$?

question.title: MH1c
question.prompt: Have you been a happy person?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: MH1d
question.prompt: Have you been a nervous person?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT7
question.prompt: During the past 6 months, how often did you want to use a condom during the times you had vaginal or anal sex with $$, regardless of whether or not you actually used them? (CARD X)

question.title: SEXALT8
question.prompt: Have you ever asked $$ to use a condom with you?

question.title: MH1e
question.prompt: Have you felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer you up?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT9
question.prompt: Has $$ ever asked you to use a condom with her?

question.title: MH1f
question.prompt: Have you been anxious or worried?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT10
question.prompt: Have you and $$ ever talked about whether to use condoms?

question.title: MH1g
question.prompt: Have you felt depressed?

option.name: A good bit of the time

question.title: SEXALT11
question.prompt: Has $$ ever been tested for HIV/AIDS?

question.title: MH2a
question.prompt:
Almost everyone has experienced times of feeling sad or depressed, and the following questions are about that.
In the past year, that is since <VAR ONE_YEAR_AGO/>, have you had 2 weeks or more during which you felt sad, blue or depressed; or when you lost all interest or pleasure in things that you usually cared about or enjoyed?

question.title: SEXALT11a
question.prompt: Do you know the results of $$'s most recent test for HIV/AIDS?

option.name: YES, PARTNER DOES NOT HAVE HIV/AIDS

question.title: MH2b
question.prompt: Have you had 2 years or more in your life when you felt depressed or sad most days, even if you felt okay sometimes?

question.title: SEXALT11b
question.prompt: Did $$ show you papers with this test result?

question.title: MH2c
question.prompt: Have you felt depressed or sad much of the time in the past year?

question.title: MH2d
question.prompt:
How much of the time during the past week did you feel depressed? Would you say...
0 Less than one day 1 1-2 days 2 3-4 days 3 5-7 days

question.title: SEXALT12a
question.prompt:
I am going to ask you how much you agree with these statements about your relationship with $$. Please answer these questions in terms of how you felt most of the time around the last time you had sex with her. (CARD X)
You were extremely committed to this relationship.

question.title: SEXALT12b
question.prompt: You depended on this person for money, food, a place to stay, or something else.

question.title: PTSD1a
question.prompt:
In your life, have you ever had any experience that was so frightening, horrible, or upsetting that, in the past month since <VAR ONE_MONTH_AGO/>, you:
Have had nightmares about it or thought about it when you did not want to?

question.title: SEXALT12c
question.prompt: Your life would have been very disrupted if the relationship ended.

question.title: PTSD1b
question.prompt: Tried hard not to think about it or went out of your way to avoid situations that reminded you of it?

question.title: PTSD1c
question.prompt: Were constantly on guard, watchful, or easily startled?

question.title: SEXALT13
question.prompt:
Were you and $$ in an exclusive, monogamous relationship (that is, you are/were only having sexual intercourse with each other and not with anyone else)?
INTERVIEWER: RESPONDENT MAY SAY THAT THEY WENT THROUGH PERIODS OF MONOGAMY AND NON-MONOGAMY. IF AT ANY TIME THERE WAS NON-MONOGAMY, CODE SEXALT13 = NO.

question.title: SEXALT14a-1
question.prompt:
Now I want to ask you about whether you or $$ used alcohol or drugs when you had vaginal or anal sex during the past 6 months - either during sex or within an hour or so before sex. (CARD X)
INTERVIEWER: NOTE SHIFT BACK TO EXCLUSION OF ORAL SEX.
INTERVIEWER: ASK IF SEXALT5 = 1 (THEY'VE HAD SEX 1 TIME),
Did your partner $$ use alcohol before or during sex?

question.title: PTSD1d
question.prompt: Felt numb or detached from others, activities, or your surroundings?

question.title: HIVTEST1
question.prompt: Have you ever been tested for HIV - yes or no?

question.title: SEXALT14b-1
question.prompt: Did you use alcohol before or during sex with her?

question.title: HIVTEST1a-m
question.prompt:
What was the date of your last HIV test? What month?
INTERVIEWER, IF ANSWER IS "DON'T KNOW" ASK, "Do you remember, how many months ago was it?"
INTERVIEWER: IF GIVEN A RANGE OF MONTHS/DAYS/WEEKS AGO, CLARIFY THE MONTH AND YEAR.

question.title: SEXALT14c-1
question.prompt: Did your partner $$ use drugs before or during sex?

question.title: SEXALT14d-1
question.prompt: Did you use drugs before or during sex with her?

question.title: HIVTEST1a-y
question.prompt: What year?

question.title: HIVTEST1b
question.prompt: The last time you got tested, did you find out your test result?

question.title: SEXALT14a-2
question.prompt: How often did your partner $$ use alcohol before or during sex?

question.title: SEXALT14b-2

question.title: SEXALT14c-2

question.title: SEXALT14d-2

question.title: HIVSUSC1a
question.preface:
Now I have some questions about your attitudes towards HIV/AIDS and condoms. Let me know how much you agree or disagree with each of the following statements, as they apply to you. (CARD X)
INTERVIEWER: TIMEFRAME FOR HIVSUSC ITEMS CAN BE NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. TIMEFRAME FOR HIVEFF ITEMS IS NOW.
question.prompt:
The next statements are intended to measure a man's opinion about the use of condoms with women. Again, let me know how much you agree or disagree with each of these statements, as they apply to you (CARD X).
It would be easy for you to get <IF HIVTEST1 == Yes "re"/>infected with HIV or AIDS.

question.title: HIVSUSC1b
question.prompt: Your behavior puts you at risk of<IF HIVTEST1 == Yes " being reinfected with"/> HIV or AIDS.

question.title: SEXALT3f
question.prompt: We have to ask this question about all sex partners. At the time you last had sex with any of these partners, did you consider her to be a prostitute? That is, was she regularly trading sex for money, drugs, or other things with different men?

question.title: HIVSUSC1c
question.prompt: You worry about getting <IF HIVTEST1 == Yes " re"/>infected with HIV or AIDS.

question.title: SEXALT15
question.prompt: Please indicate which partner you have done any of the following things to (if any): punched her or hit her with something that could hurt, like a fist or object; choked or burned her; beat her up; kicked or bit her; threatened her with a knife or a gun; thrown you against the wall; or something like that?

question.title: SEXALT16
question.prompt: For any of these partners, without her permission, have you touched her private parts in a sexual way, made her do something sexual, or made her have sex with you? Here, by sex I mean vaginal, anal, or oral sex.

question.title: HIVSUSC1d
question.prompt: You try to protect yourself from being <IF HIVTEST1 == Yes "re"/>infected with HIV or AIDS.

question.title: HIVEFF1a
question.prompt:
The next statements are intended to measure a man's opinion about the use of condoms with women. Again, let me know how much you agree or disagree with each of these statements, as they apply to you (CARD X).
It is easy for you to have a condom with you when you are going to have sex.
question.citation: Bogart et al., 2005 study of IDU's, with items adapted from Brown's 1984 Attitudes Towards Condom Scale

question.title: EV1ID1
question.preface: In the next part of the interview, we will be talking about the most recent time you had vaginal or anal sex with a woman. You mentioned earlier that the last time you had sex was with $$ and that this occurred within the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>. So please take a minute and think back to this particular time you had sex with $$.
question.prompt: What month did you last have sex with $$?

question.title: HIVEFF1b
question.prompt: It is hard for you to get condoms.
question.citation: Short version of the Jemmott & Jemmott 1991 scale used in NIDA

question.title: EV1ID2
question.prompt: Was this the first time you had sex with $$?

question.title: EV1ID3
question.prompt: How well do you remember this time you had sex with $$? Would you say (CHOOSE ONE):

question.title: HIVEFF1c
question.prompt: It is too much trouble to carry around condoms.
question.citation: Short version of the Jemmott & Jemmott 1991 scale used in NIDA

question.title: EV1RC5
question.prompt:
Were you having sex with other people at the time?
INTERVIEWER: THIS MEANS SEX OUTSIDE THE RELATIONSHIP RATHER THAN GROUP SEX.

question.title: HIVEFF1d
question.prompt: You can put on a condom without ruining the mood.
question.citation: Short version of the Jemmott & Jemmott 1991 scale used in NIDA

question.title: EV1RC5a
question.prompt: How many other people were you having sex with at that time?

question.title: HIVEFF1e
question.prompt: If you are sexually aroused you can stop before sex to use a condom.
question.citation: Short version of the Jemmott & Jemmott 1991 scale used in NIDA

question.title: HIVKNa
question.prompt:
Now here are more general questions about HIV/AIDS. Again, let me know how much you agree or disagree with each statement (CARD X).
A person can get HIV/AIDS by having sex with a person who has HIV/AIDS.

question.title: EV1RC6
question.prompt: Did you think that $$ was having sex with other people at the time?

question.title: EV1RC7
question.prompt: At that time when you and $$ had sex, how much did you trust that she would not give you HIV/AIDS or any sexually transmitted infection?: not at all, a little bit, somewhat, quite a bit, or completely. (CARD X)

question.title: HIVKNb
question.prompt: Using a condom can protect a man and his sex partner from getting HIV/AIDS during sex.

question.title: EV1RC8
question.prompt: At that time when you and $$ had sex, how much were you concerned about protecting her from getting HIV or any kind of sexually transmitted infection? Were you concerned: not at all, a little bit, somewhat, quite a bit, or completely. (CARD X)

question.title: HIVKNc
question.prompt: Looking at a person is enough to tell if he or she has HIV/AIDS.

question.title: EV1RC9
question.prompt: At that time when you and $$ had sex, was she pregnant or trying to become pregnant?

question.title: HIVKNd
question.prompt: If a woman has a good reputation, it's not as important to use a condom.

question.title: HIVKNe
question.prompt: Pulling out before a man "cums" helps protect a man or his sex partner from getting HIV during sex.

question.title: EV1RC10
question.prompt: At that time, was $$ on some form of birth control or contraceptive such as birth control pills, patch, vaginal ring, shot, implant, IUD, or diaphragm? Please don't count using condoms in your answer.

question.title: CONBEL1a
question.prompt:
OK, and here are some general statements about a man's use of condoms with women - let me know how much you agree or disagree with each one.
Using condoms can be difficult.

question.title: EV1SC1
question.preface: Now we're going to talk about the most recent time you had sex.
question.prompt:
When you and $$ met up that time was this a chance meeting (that is, you had not expected to meet up with her)?
INTERVIEWER: THIS IS NOT ABOUT WHETHER THEY PLANNED TO HAVE SEX - JUST WHETHER THEY PLANNED TO MEET. IF R W/ PARTNER ALL THE TIME CODE "NO"

question.title: CONBEL1b
question.prompt: Using condoms makes sex less enjoyable.

question.title: EV1SC2a
question.prompt:
That time with $$, was there something different or special about this event? For example...
Had you not seen each other in a long time?

question.prompt: Was one of you going away for awhile?

question.title: CONBEL1d
question.prompt: Condoms break too often.

question.title: EV1SC2d

question.title: PREG
question.prompt:
Thinking about your life right now, how important is it to you to avoid getting a woman pregnant?
1 Very important 2 Somewhat important 3 A little important 4 Not at all important

question.title: AUDIT1
question.preface: The next questions are about your use of alcohol. I'll ask you about the past 12 months and then about the past 6 months. When I say "drink," I mean a can or bottle of beer, a glass of wine or a wine cooler, a shot of liquor, or a mixed drink with liquor in it. I am not asking about times when you only had a sip or two from a drink. With this definition in mind...
question.prompt:
During the past 12 months, that is, since <VAR ONE_YEAR_AGO/>, how often have you had a drink containing alcohol? (CARD X)
INTERVIEWER: If R has difficulty with AUDIT1 due to inconsistent drinking over past year, say: "Then please think about the time when you were drinking the most in the past year."
INTERVIEWER: IF AUDIT1 = 0, PROBE: "So you have not had even one beer or wine cooler or other drink since <VAR ONE_YEAR_AGO/>?"

question.title: EV1SC3

question.title: EV1SC4a
question.prompt:
When you were having sex that time:
did either of you feel that you needed more privacy?

question.prompt: In the past year, how many drinks containing alcohol did you have on a typical day when you were drinking?

question.title: EV1SC4b
question.prompt: Did either of you feel concerned that others might see you, hear you, or interrupt you? (for example, you were in a public place or other people were around)?

question.title: ALC3
question.preface: Now let's talk specifically about the past 6 months, that is, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>.
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol? (CARD X)
INTERVIEWER: IF R HAS DIFFICULTY WITH "DRINK": By "drink" I mean a can or bottle of beer, a glass of wine or a wine cooler, a shot of liquor, or a mixed drink with liquor in it. I am not asking about times when you only had a sip or two from a drink.
INTERVIEWER: IF R HAS DIFFICULTY WITH ANY REMAINING ALCOHOL ITEM (ALC3-ALC5) DUE TO INCONSISTENT DRINKING OVER PAST 6 MO. SAY, "Then think about how often, on average, did you do this during the past 6 months."
INTERVIEWER: If response = 0, PROBE: "So you have not had even one beer or wine cooler or other drink since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>?"
question.citation: NIAAA TASK FORCE - 6 ITEM SET -- MODIFIED

option.name: 1 or 2 times in the past 6 months
3 to 5 times in the past 6 months

question.title: DRUG1

The next questions are about the use of drugs. INTERVIEWER: If R has difficulty with any drug item due to inconsistent drug use over past 6 months, say: "Then think about how often, on average, did you use [DRUG] during the past 6 months."

question.title: DRUG5
question.preface: The next questions are about your use of drugs on your own. By "on your own" I mean either without a doctor's prescription, in larger amounts than prescribed, or for a longer period than prescribed. We are not interested in your use of "over-the-counter" drugs that can be bought in drug stores or grocery stores without a doctor's prescription. With this definition in mind...
question.prompt:
During the past 12 months, did you use prescription pain relievers, tranquilizers, sedatives, or barbituates on your own? Again, we're not interested in your use of "over-the-counters" such as aspirin, Tylenol, or Nytol.
[CARD W/ OTHER EXAMPLES OF PAIN RELIEVERS FOR INTERVIEWER'S REFERENCE: Codeine, Demerol, Darvon/Darvocet, Tylenol with codeine (thang), Percocet/Percodan, Tylox, Vicodin, Lortab/Lorcet, Dilaudid, Fioricet, Fiorinal, Hydrocodone, Methadone, Morphine, OxyContin, Phenaphen with Codeine, Propoxyphene, SK-65, Stadol, Talacen, Talwin, Talwin NX, Tramadol, Ultram]
[CARD W/ OTHER EXAMPLES OF TRANQUILIZERS FOR INTERVIEWER'S REFERENCE: Xanax, Valium, Klonopin, Clonazepam, Alprazolam, Ativan, Lorazepam, Diazepam, Atarax, BuSpar, Equanil, Flexeril, Librium, Limbitrol, Meprobamate, Miltown, Rohypnol, Serax, Soma, Tranxene, Vistaril]
[CARD W/ OTHER EXAMPLES OF SEDATIVES FOR INTERVIEWER'S REFERENCE: Methaqualone, Sopor, Quaalude, Nembutal, Pentobarbital, Seconal, Secobarbital, Butalbital, Restoril, Temazepam, Amytal, Butisol, Chloral Hydrate, Dalmane, Halcion, Phenobarbital, Placidyl, Tuinal]

question.title: NEFF1a
question.preface:
Now I'm going to present you with some different ideas that some people have about men and women. Please let me know how much you agree or disagree with each idea. 1 = strongly disagree, 2 = somewhat disagree, 3 = somewhat agree, and 4 = strongly agree. (CARD X)
EVERY 7 QUESTIONS OR SO, REMIND RESPONDENTS OF THE RESPONSE SCALE. Again, you can say...

question.title: EV1SU9
question.prompt: To what extent do you think that your partner's drug use influenced whether or not you used condoms: not at all, a little bit, somewhat, or quite a bit? (CARD X)

question.title: EV1SU10a
question.prompt: Did you use drugs within an hour or so before sex?

question.title: DSS1j
question.prompt: When it comes to sex, the man should always make the first move, not the woman.

question.title: EV1SU10b
question.prompt: Did you use drugs during sex?

question.title: DISTRUST1a
question.prompt: It is generally safer not to trust women too much.

question.title: DISTRUST1b
question.prompt: When it comes down to it a lot of women are dishonest.

question.title: EV1SU11
question.prompt:
What drugs were you using?
INTERVIEWER: DO NOT READ DRUG CHOICES, BUT CHECK ALL THAT ARE MENTIONED

question.title: DISTRUST1c
question.prompt: I think that most women would lie just to get ahead.

question.title: EV1SU12
question.prompt: To what extent do you think that your own drug use influenced whether or not you used condoms: not at all, a little bit, somewhat, or quite a bit? (CARD X)

question.title: DISTRUST1d
question.prompt: Women are just as trustworthy as men.

question.title: DEVALUING1a
question.prompt: Women seek to gain power by getting control over men.

question.title: CCMASCa
question.prompt:
You're doing a great job. Here are some more ideas that some people have about men and women. Keep telling me how much you agree or disagree with each statement.
If a man can get away with having sex without a condom, he should.

question.title: CCMASCb
question.prompt: A man is justified in getting angry with a woman if he catches a sexually transmitted disease from her.

question.title: CCMASCc
question.prompt: In a serious relationship, a woman who asks a man to use a condom is probably cheating on him.

question.title: CCMASCd
question.prompt: If a man pays for sex, he should not have to use a condom.

question.title: CCMASCe
question.prompt: Sometimes men just need to have sex, no matter how they get it or who it's with.

question.title: CCMASCf
question.prompt: If a man has an opportunity to have sex, he should not turn it down.

question.title: CCMASCg
question.prompt: If a woman refuses sex with her man, she is giving him the "green light" to have sex with other women.

question.title: CCMASCh
question.prompt: There's something wrong with a man who has no interest in sex.

question.title: CCMASCi
question.prompt: It's not worth the effort to have a stable and committed relationship.

question.title: CCMASCj
question.prompt: A woman can be a man's greatest source of strength, but she can also destroy him.

question.title: CCMASCk
question.prompt: It is less trouble for men to pay for sex than to have a relationship with a woman.

question.title: CCMASCl
question.prompt: Men have to provide protection for women.

question.title: CCMASCm
question.prompt: Women expect men to support them financially.

question.title: CCMASCn
question.prompt: A man should NOT expect sex from a woman, just because he spent money on her.

question.title: CCMASCo
question.prompt: When men physically hurt women, sometimes it's the woman's fault.

question.title: RELBARa
question.prompt:
Next are some ideas that some people have about relationships when a man is homeless or on the street. Again, tell me how much you agree or disagree with each statement.
It's almost impossible to have a serious, long-term relationship with a woman if you're homeless.
question.citation: Barriers to relationships/sex for homeless men

question.title: RELBARb
question.prompt: Relationships on the street just make your problems worse.

question.title: RELBARc
question.prompt: It's hard to have serious relationships on the street, because there is no privacy or place to be alone together.

question.title: RELBARd
question.prompt: It's very difficult for a homeless man to support a woman on the street.

question.title: RELBARe
question.prompt: Protecting a woman on the street is difficult and dangerous.

question.title: RELBARf
question.prompt: If you try to have a relationship on the street, she will probably leave you for someone else.

question.title: RELBARg
question.prompt: There are not many good women on the street to have relationships with.

question.title: RELBARh
question.prompt: Homeless men don't have a lot of opportunities for sex unless they pay for it.

question.title: RELBARi
question.prompt: If you're homeless and you want have sex, you have to take a lot of risks.

question.title: PWRDYNMa
question.prompt:
Now, please think about what typically happens in your relationships with women. Please let me know how much you agree or disagree about what typically happens: 1 = strongly disagree to 4 = strongly agree.
Most of the time, we do what she wants to do.
question.citation: modified and shortened version of a Pulerwitz's standard subscale

question.title: PWRDYNMb
question.prompt: I tell her what she should and should not wear

question.title: PWRDYNMc
question.prompt: I don't want her to do most of the talking when we're together.

question.title: PWRDYNMd
question.prompt: I tell her who she can spend time with.

question.title: PWRDYNMe
question.prompt: I do what I want to do, even if she disagrees.

question.title: PWRDYNMf
question.prompt: When she and I disagree, she gets her way most of the time.

question.title: PWRDYNMg
question.prompt: I always need to know where she is when she isn't with me

question.title: SEX1
question.preface: The next questions ask about sexual behavior. I know that people have different kinds of sex with different kinds of people, so I hope that you will be honest with me. I've heard just about everything doing these interviews. But if you feel uncomfortable talking about something, please let me know. Also, remember that you can skip any question that you do not want to answer.
question.prompt: Which of these terms best describes your sexual orientation? 1 Heterosexual (straight) 2 Homosexual (gay, lesbian) 3 Bisexual 4 Not sure 5 Other (SPECIFY: _____________)

question.title: SEX2
question.prompt:
Some of the following questions ask about sexual intercourse. When I say sexual intercourse, I mean either vaginal sex or anal sex - do not include oral sex in your answer. OK?
During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, how many times did you have sexual intercourse with female partners? If you had sex more than once with a partner on a single occasion, please count these as separate times. If you had sex with more than one partner at one time, count these as separate times. So, this is the total number of times you had sex, whether with the same female partner or different ones.
INTERVIEWER: IF NEEDED, DEFINE VAGINAL SEX AS "PENIS IN VAGINA" AND ANAL SEX AS "SEX IN THE BEHIND"

question.title: SEX2a
question.prompt: And of these <VAR SEX2/> times, how many times did you use a condom?

question.title: SEX2b
question.prompt: During the past 6 months, how many different female partners did you have sexual intercourse with?

question.title: SEX2c
question.prompt: How many of these <VAR SEX2b/> partners did you consider serious or primary partners - like a wife or girlfriend - the last time you had sex with them?

question.title: SEX2d
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did you give any of these <VAR SEX2c/> serious or primary partners money, drugs, or anything else in exchange for sex?
INTERVIEWER: IF R ASKS WHETHER WE'RE ASKING JUST ABOUT PROSTITUTES, ANSWER: "WE'RE ASKING ABOUT ANY SERIOUS OR PRIMARY PARTNER WHO YOU GAVE MONEY, DRUGS OR ANYTHING ELSE TO IN EXCHANGE FOR SEX."
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX2e
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did any of these <VAR SEX2c/> serious or primary partners give YOU money, drugs, or anything else in exchange for sex?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX2f
question.prompt:
So you had <CALC SEX2b-SEX2c/> partner(s) who were NOT serious partners the last time you had sex with them? These are sometimes called "casual partners" and they include sex partners who are once-in-a-while, "in the moment," "just for fun," "one night stands" or women you pay for sex. Is it correct that you had <CALC SEX2b-SEX2c/> of these partners in the past 6 months?
[INTERVIEWER: CHECK TO MAKE SURE THIS IS CORRECT. IF INCORRECT, GO BACK AND CHANGE SEX2C, CORRECT SEX2D & SEX 2E IF NECESSARY. OTHERWISE, ENTER NUMBER AND MOVE ON TO THE NEXT QUESTION.]

question.title: SEX2fa
question.prompt: INTERVIEWER, PLEASE ENTER THIS NUMBER: <CALC SEX2b-SEX2c/>

question.title: SEX2g
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did YOU GIVE money, drugs, or anything else in exchange for sex with any of these <VAR SEX2f/> "casual partners"?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX2h
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did any of these <VAR SEX2f/> "casual partners" give YOU money, drugs, or anything else in exchange for sex?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX2i
question.prompt:
Did you consider any of the <VAR SEX2b/> women you had sex with, including both serious and casual partners, to be prostitutes the last time you had sex with them? That is, were they regularly trading sex for money, drugs, or other things with different men and negotiating a price before engaging in sex with them?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX3
question.preface: Now we are switching to talk about male sex partners.
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did you have sex with any MALE partners? By sex I mean giving or getting anal sex, not oral sex.
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER 0.
IF YES: ASK, "How many times did you have sexual intercourse with male partners? As I mentioned earlier with female partners, if you had intercourse more than once with a partner on a single occasion, please count these as separate times. If you had sex with more than one partner on a single occasion, count each of these partners separately. So, this is the total number of times you had sex, whether with the same male partner or different ones.

question.title: SEX3a
question.prompt: And of these <VAR SEX3/> times, how many times did you and your partner use a condom?

question.title: SEX3b
question.prompt: During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, how many different male partners did you have sex with?

question.title: SEX3c
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/> did any of these <VAR SEX3b/> male partners give YOU money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex the last time you had sex with them?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX3d
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, did YOU GIVE any of these <VAR SEX3b/> male partners money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex?
INTERVIEWER: IF NO, ENTER "0." IF YES, ASK, "How many?" AND ENTER THE NUMBER.

question.title: SEX3f
question.prompt: Of the <VAR SEX3b/> male partners that you had sex with in the past 6 months, how many of them would you describe as a prostitute? That is, were they regularly trading sex for money, drugs, or other things with different men and negotiating a price before engaging in sex with them?

question.title: SEX3a2
question.prompt: Did you or your partner use a condom that time?

question.title: SEX3b2
question.prompt: Did your partner give YOU money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex?

question.title: SEX3c2
question.prompt: Did YOU GIVE your partner money, food, a place to stay, drugs, or something else in exchange for sex?

question.title: SEX3f2
question.prompt: At the time you had sex with him, did you consider your partner to be a prostitute? That is, were they regularly trading sex for money, drugs, or other things with different men and negotiating a price before engaging in sex with them?

question.title: SEX4
question.prompt:
During the past 6 months, since <VAR SIX_MONTHS_AGO/>, have you had a sexual relationship with two or more of these <VAR SEX2b/> female partners<IF SEX3 > 0 " and <VAR SEX3/> male partners"/> within the same three-week period?
INTERVIEWER: IF R IS NOT SURE, TELL HIM IT IS OKAY TO GIVE HIS BEST ESTIMATE
INTERVIEWER: IF R HAS MENTIONED MALE SEX PARTNERS, STATE: "Please consider both female and male partners in your answer."

question.title: ABU1
question.preface: Now I need to ask you some personal questions about things you may have experienced. Again, I'd like to remind you that this survey is anonymous, so I hope you will be honest with me.
question.prompt: Have you ever done any of the following kinds of things to a woman?: punched or hit a woman with something that could hurt, like a fist or object; choked or burned a woman; beaten a woman up; kicked or bit a woman; threatened a woman with a knife or a gun; thrown a woman down or against a wall; or something like that?

question.title: ABU2
question.prompt: In the past 6 months, has anyone, man or woman, done any of these things to you?

question.title: ABU3
question.prompt: Have you ever, against a woman's wishes, touched her private parts in a sexual way, made her do something sexual, or made her have sex with you? For this question, by "sex" I mean vaginal, anal, or oral sex.

expression.name: SOME PARTNER D OR A USE
SEXALT14b-1 NOT = NO and ALC3=SOME DRINK
SEXALT14d-1 NOT = NO AND SOME DRUGS
